ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned various biochemical laboratory techniques as well as developed my skills in scientific writing.

This course gave me a space to work on basic laboratory skills and research. I learned topics such as how to do an SDS-gel, experimental design, and protein purification. I learned that a lab course does not have to be stressful given a good lab environment and helpful professors/TAs.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course does a good job at providing a good laboratory environment for students to develop lab and research skills. I learned that a lab course does not have to be stressful given a good lab environment and helpful professors/TAs. I was actually interested and engaged with doing the experiments each week. The professors and TA are very nice and willing to help students learn and succeed in the course. However, it connected only very little to the accompanying biochemistry lecture course I took. The course is well organized with 2 projects each ending with a lab report and weekly quizzes. The quizzes were straightforward and all that was needed to do well on them and prepare for them was to read the lab manual and/or watch some videos. The TAs and professors were always willing to answer questions and explain topics further when needed. The example lab reports were also very helpful in giving students an idea of how to approach the lab report assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This was the best MCDB lab I have taken so far. Very comfortable and welcoming environment with great, helpful professors and TAs.  I learned that a lab course does not have to be stressful given a good lab environment and helpful professors/TAs. I was actually interested and engaged with doing the experiments each week. The two lab reports can be tedious, long assignments to complete but the only thing in the course besides these 2 assignments are weekly, straightforward quizzes. The example lab reports were also very helpful in giving students an idea of how to approach the lab report assignments.  Low workload overall, but just watch out for those 2 lab reports.
